messages.message:
It seems for this, the params are not automatically accessible but exporting it works correctly. @mfichman could you take a look at this? I am somewhat opting for this route so I don't need to rebuild all the services with `cs build`

```(3.9.17) owner@dev:~/instabase/shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db$ bazel run tools/dbmigrate
INFO: Analyzed target //shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db/tools/dbmigrate:dbmigrate (0 packages loaded, 0 targets configured).
INFO: Found 1 target...
Aspect //third-party/bazel/py/rules_mypy:mypy.bzl%mypy_aspect of //shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db/tools/dbmigrate:dbmigrate up-to-date (nothing to build)
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.169s, Critical Path: 0.00s
INFO: 1 process: 1 internal.
INFO: Build completed successfully, 1 total action
INFO: Running command line: bazel-bin/shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db/tools/dbmigrate/dbmigrate_/dbmigrate
2025/02/19 22:02:43 INFO utils/db/tools/dbmigrate/main.go:47 -- Migrate database schema to version latest
2025/02/19 22:02:43 ERROR utils/db/session/dbsession.go:218 -- SQL DB: Failed to parse DB params: Empty DBParam string
2025/02/19 22:02:43 FATAL utils/db/accessor/db_accessor.go:126 -- Empty DBParam string```
Try `make db-dev-init` instead; that picks up the params
Sorry -- I gave the wrong command earlier!
no worries, thanks Matt! Right now, my crafting env is updated, I'll try it out when the next migration needs to be ported to my crafting db
